intro: Anisantha, commonly known as the "spearthorn," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, spiny bracts and small, clustered flowers. The plants typically grow in moist or wet habitats, such as marshes and stream banks. Anisantha species are often found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. They play a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various insects and small animals.
